Welcome to sphinx_lab2’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class main.AceCard(suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the ace card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.Hand¶

Bases: object

Here are some comments on the Hand class

add_card(card)¶
Parameters:card – An object of type PlayingCard
Returns:Nothing, it adds a card to the players Hand object
best_poker_hand(table_cards)¶

This method evaluates which cards in Hand makes best possible combination of cards. :param table_cards: A list of cards represented on the table :return: A PokerHand which is fully comparable with other PokerHand’s with the normal comparable operators.

best_poker_hand_total(table_cards)¶

A simple method which collects all cards for a player, which includes the cards represented on the table in certain games. :param table_cards: Cards in a list representing tha cards on the table. :return: a list of all possible cards for a player.

remove_card(index)¶
Parameters:index – a list of indices of which cards should be thrown away
Returns:Removes one or multiple cards from Hand if possible
sort_hand()¶

Sorts the hand by suit and then by value. :return: Sorted cards in Hand.

class main.JackCard(suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the jack card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.KingCard(suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the king card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.NumberedCard(value, suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the numbered card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.PlayingCard(suit)¶

Bases: object

This class represents a standard class for all individual cards in a deck.

get_name()¶
Returns:The name of the card, for instance “Jack” or “1” etc.
get_suit()¶
Returns:The suit of the card, either spade, diamond, clubs or hearts.
get_value()¶
Returns:The value of the card, ranging from 2 to 14.
class main.PokerHand(hand_rank, rank_value)¶

Bases: object

Uses PokerHandType to create an PokerHand object. Overrides some comparable operators for easier comparisons.

class main.PokerHandType¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

A PokerHandType class which specifies which kind of PokerHand is worth the most.

class main.QueenCard(suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the queen card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.Suits¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

An enumeration.

main.create_bins_for_cards(cards)¶

A method that creates bins for a Hand which is then used in best_poker_hand. :param cards: All cards available for a player. :return: Returns some lists of values and suits.

main.flush_test(cards, suit_cards, list)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a flush. :param cards: The cards available for the player to evaluate. :param suit_cards: A list of the suits the player has. :param list: A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand. :return: Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a flush, otherwise False and None.

main.four_of_a_kind_test(list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has four of a kind. :param list: A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand. :param value_cards: The values of the cards in Hand. :return: Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has four of a kind, otherwise False and None.

main.full_house_test(list)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a full house. :param list: A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand. :return: Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a full house, otherwise False and None.

main.high_card_test(list)¶

A method to evaluate what the highest card in players Hand is. :param list: A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand. :return: Returns True and a PokerHand object with the highest cards in the players Hand.

main.one_pair_test(list)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a pair. :param list: A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand. :return: Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a pair, otherwise False and None.

main.straight_flush_test(cards, suit_cards, list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a straight flush. :param cards: The cards available for the player to evaluate. :param suit_cards: A list of the suits the player has. :param list: A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand. :param value_cards: The values of the cards in Hand. :return: Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a straight flush, otherwise False and None.

main.straight_test(list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a straight. :param list: A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand. :param value_cards: The values of the cards in Hand. :return: Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a straight, otherwise False and None.

main.three_of_a_kind_test(list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a three of a kind. :param list: A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand. :param value_cards: The values of the cards in Hand. :return: Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a three of a kind, otherwise False and None.

main.two_pairs_test(list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has two pairs. :param list: A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand. :param value_cards: The values of the cards in Hand. :return: Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has two pairs, otherwise False and None.
